com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Class Droid4mizer<AggregateClass>

java.lang.Object
  com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.Droid4mizer<AggregateClass>
All Implemented Interfaces:
AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic, Droid4mizerInterface, SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>, Smarted<AggregateClass>, LifeCycle
public final class Droid4mizer<AggregateClass>
extends java.lang.Object
implements SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>, Droid4mizerInterface

The class that should be used when extending a legacy class to support the whole droid4me framework features.

Since:
2011.06.14
Author:
Édouard Mercier

registerBroadcastListeners

public void registerBroadcastListeners(AppPublics.BroadcastListener[] broadcastListeners)
Description copied from interface: Smarted
Explicitly registers wrapped broadcast receivers for the Activity.

Those receivers will be unregistered by the Activity.onDestroy() method.

When invoking that method, all previously registered listeners via the AppPublics.BroadcastListenerProvider or AppPublics.BroadcastListenersProvider are kept.

Specified by:
registerBroadcastListeners in interface Smarted<AggregateClass>
Parameters:
broadcastListeners - the wrapped receivers to registers

onBusinessObjectsRetrieved

public void onBusinessObjectsRetrieved()
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
This is the typical callback that will be invoked when the business objects have been actually retrieved. It is strongly adviced not to modify the GUI during this method execution.

It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread! If the Activity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this method will be invoked from a high-priority worker thread.

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

Specified by:
onBusinessObjectsRetrieved in interface LifeCycle

isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay

public boolean isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay()
Description copied from interface: AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Indicates whether the extending Activity also implementing the LifeCycle interface is in the middle of a LifeCycle#refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable) call.

It is very handy when it comes to disable certain things, like menu entries, while an Activity is loading.

Specified by:
isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay in interface AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Returns:
true if and only if the LifeCycle#refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable) is being executed.

refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay

public void refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean retrieveBusinessObjects,
                                             java.lang.Runnable onOver,
                                             boolean immediately)
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
Asks the implementing Activity to reload its business objects and to synchronize its display. The method invokes the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() and LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() methods.

Must be invoked only from the UI thread, when the SmartActivity is synchronous!

Specified by:
refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay in interface LifeCycle
Parameters:
retrieveBusinessObjects - indicates whether the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method should be invoked or not
onOver - if not null, this method will be eventually invoked from the UI thread
immediately - if this flag is set to true, even if the implementing Activity is not currently displayed, the execution will be run at once. If set to false, the execution will be delayed until the Activity.onRestart() method is invoked

getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount

public final int getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount()
Description copied from interface: AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Enables to know how many times the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method has been invoked, which may be useful when you do not want this method to do something that the LifeCycle.onFulfillDisplayObjects() method may have already done.

Specified by:
getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount in interface AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Returns:
the number of time the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method has actually been invoked

isFirstLifeCycle

public final boolean isFirstLifeCycle()
Description copied from interface: AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Is not invoked by the framework, and provides information about the current entity life cycle.

Specified by:
isFirstLifeCycle in interface AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Returns:
true if and only if the entity life cycle is the first time to execute during its container life

onActuallyCreated

public void onActuallyCreated()
This callback method will be invoked when the activity is being created, during the Activity.onCreate(Bundle) method execution, but not when it is recreated due to a configuration change.

onActuallyDestroyed

public void onActuallyDestroyed()
This callback method will be invoked when the activity is being destroyed, during the Activity.onDestroy() method execution, but not when it is destroyed due to a configuration change.

shouldKeepOn

public boolean shouldKeepOn()
Indicates whether nothing went wrong during the implementing activity, or if a redirection is being processed.

Thanks to the redirection controller, it is possible to re-route any activity when it starts, if some other activity needs to be executed beforehand.

Returns:
true if and only if the implementing Activity should resume its execution

onFulfillDisplayObjects

public void onFulfillDisplayObjects()
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
This is the place where the derived class can initialize the previously retrieved graphical objects. The method is invoked during the Activity.onResume() execution, and only the very first time.

It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

Specified by:
onFulfillDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

onRetrieveBusinessObjects

public void onRetrieveBusinessObjects()
                               throws LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
This is the place where to load the business objects. It is strongly adviced not to modify the GUI during this method execution.

It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

Specified by:
onRetrieveBusinessObjects in interface LifeCycle
Throws:
LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException

onRetrieveDisplayObjects

public void onRetrieveDisplayObjects()
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
This is the place where the derived class can get all graphical objects and put them into attributes. The method is invoked during the Activity.onCreate(android.os.Bundle) execution, after the parent Activity.onCreate(android.os.Bundle) method has been invoked.

It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

Specified by:
onRetrieveDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

onSynchronizeDisplayObjects

public void onSynchronizeDisplayObjects()
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
Will be invoked during the Activity.onResume() execution, every time. It is supposed to fulfill the display objects that may need some refreshing due to the underlying business objects that have changed.

It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

Specified by:
onSynchronizeDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

getPreferences

public android.content.SharedPreferences getPreferences()
Specified by:
getPreferences in interface Droid4mizerInterface
